main event: A civilian in Clinton, Pa. observed a yellow-gray spherical object, possibly the size of a basketball, traveling at high speed for approximately 1 minute.
interesting points: The object was described as a solid spherical object moving in a zig-zag pattern to the east and then 10 degrees west before traveling straight and level from west to east.
The sighting occurred approximately 4 miles east-southeast of Greater Pittsburgh Airport.
The observer was an 18-year-old civilian named M.s. Houstille.
The report suggests the possibility of the object being a jet aircraft due to its bright path and color.
The document is a part of Project Blue Book, the United States Air Force's study of unidentified flying objects.
sighted object: yellow-gray spherical object, possibly the size of a basketball
